comments:
Build ID: I20070625-1500

Steps To Reproduce:
The get a starting ACServer I had to gave all scripts and executables in the agent controller bin directory the executable rights. Then the ACServer starts but doesn't stop with ACServer -shutdown. The result is an endless wait of eclipse. I can only kill eclipse to solve this. Than I changed the ACStop.sh and RAStop.sh scripts to kill the relevant processes. So now I can stop and start the ACServer from within eclipse. The test connection function gives me a positiv result. But when I try to profile a application I get the following error:

The process launcher seems to be inactive.  Restart the Agent Controller and try again.

The retstart doesn't help. Thank you for your help.

More information:

Here is the tptp agent log from my profile try.

<CommonBaseEvent creationTime="2007-09-27T11:22:49.246475Z" globalInstanceId="A6FB92890003C2C147F5A65679BFDD2F" msg="Received command for unrecognized interface: iid=org.eclipse.tptp.eventProvider, cmd=listenerAccepted" severity="50" version="1.0.1">

	<sourceComponentId component="ProcessController" componentIdType="TPTPComponent" componentType="Eclipse_TPTP" executionEnvironment="BaseAgentImpl.cpp, line 753" instanceId="101" location="elaste" locationType="IPV4" processId="21251" subComponent="ProcessController" threadId="21251"/>
	<situation categoryName="ReportSituation">

	<sourceComponentId component="AgentController" componentIdType="TPTPComponent" executionEnvironment="fileServer.c, line 177" instanceId="1004" location="elaste" locationType="IPV4" processId="21229" subComponent="Client Compatibility TL" threadId="21229" componentType="Eclipse_TPTP"/>

Hi Martin,
What kind of Agent Controller are you using - integrated or standalone?
Could you please try any last build of standalone AC 4.5 or 4.4.1?

I tried standalone and integrated. On both I get the same result. But I need the integrated. I will try this version: http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/download.php?file=/tptp/4.5.0/dev/TPTP-4.5.0-200710190400/tptp.runtime.allInOne.linux.gtk.x86-TPTP-4.5.0-200710190400.zip 
Is this the version you mean. Thank you for your help.
I tried the version from my last post and the problem is the same. I get the message that no agent controller is running.

I tried like successed the remote agent controller. I get following results:
./ACStart.sh: 52: [[: not found

This can be fixed by setting /bin/sh to /bin/bash because on my system (ubuntu) the link sh points to dash.

ACServer: error while loading shared libraries: libtptpUtils.so.4: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

This is can be fixed by renaming the libs from *.4.4.0 to *.4

Next problem is:

./ACServer: error while loading shared libraries: libssl.so.2: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

Fixed this by setting an symlink to libssl.so

Now it starts. But ps shows:
20508 pts/0    S      0:00 ACServer
20510 pts/0    Z      0:00 [tptpProcessCont] <defunct>

A zombie process from tptp. Now I will try to connect.

Trie to connect with sample client that shows:
ERROR: Unable to connect to the Agent Controller running on localhost at port number 10006
Does no one of the developers use this linux version? Who compiles this version? How can I compile this version?
Bing, would you please see if you can assist Martin with this please?

With a self compiled version the Sampleclient works. But if I connect from eclipse I got the following error in the rac log.

ptrace() call failed for pid 14379
PC monitorProcessState: Failed to monitor process 14379
Agent Manager received an unexpected error response TPTP_Error

Martin,
Let's investigate the problem with original AC 4.5 build.
Please provide servicelog.log file with DEBUG level.
Thanks.

I sent a log file before. And now after such a long talk you say enable DEBUG and you think I know how to enable it? Please, be more helpful.

I say it again first problem is that it is linked against libraries that aren't in the package, the second problem is that the executebles aren't marked as one, the third is that it is linked against a libssl.so.2 that version doesn't exist in my distribution (only version 0.9.8) and the fourth is that the shell scripts use bash specific things but insert /bin/sh on my system this is a link to /bin/dash. So if no one is fixing this I cannot help. And that's why I compiled it myself. But this was a big pain. It needs a lot of changes in the source because files like asm/system.h doesn't exist on my system and I have the kernel source installed. Some functions that are called seemed to be outdated on my linux kernel (2.6.22) e.g. syscall1.

I have to use tptp for my bachelor theses. Please help me to get it running.

Martin, 
Let's try any last 4.5 build of Agent Controller from http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/downloads/?ver=4.5.0

I see that the main problem is defuncting of the tptpProcessController process.
Please download and install standalone Agent Controller.
Currently AC doesn't depend on openssl package and you don't need libssl library now.

To enable DEBUG please modify file $TPTP_AC_HOME\config\serviceconfig.xml - substitute level attribute in the <Logging..> tag by "DEBUG" value.

BTW: To build AC you can use AC.SDK which contains some required low level libraries, so you can don't deal with kernel headers.

Hi Martin,
Do you have any update on this?

I have done a quick test. No defunct process on startup (great). But I get the following message on startup of ACServer:

Starting Agent Controller.
Exception in thread "Thread-0" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/hyades/internal/execution/file/FileServer
ACServer started successfully.

The sample client works.

But I do not tried to profile from eclipse. I will test this on the weekend. Is this version also available as the integrated profiler?

Thank you for your help.

This is strange message.
FileServer class should be contained in $TPTP_AC_HOME/plugins/org.eclipse.hyades.execution_build_number/hexl.jar archive.

JVMTI profiling doesn't need this class and should work without it.
TPTP_AC_HOME is set to %RASERVER_HOME% and RASERVER_HOME is set to the home of rac. So the jar isn't explicitly add to the classpath.

I tried remote profiling from eclipse and it works now like excpected. Great. I downloaded the complete tptp package from 2007-11-13 and tried the internal but had for now nosuccess. I will try with the iac next week again. Thanks for the your help.

I tried with the IAC and get the follwing exception in the log:
!ENTRY org.eclipse.tptp.platform.iac.administrator 4 0 2007-11-27 11:14:16.438
!MESSAGE IAC could not be started due to invalid configuration files.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui 4 4 2007-11-27 11:14:19.565
!MESSAGE 
!STACK 1
org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: 
        at org.eclipse.tptp.trace.ui.provisional.launcher.AbstractProcessLauncher.configureProcess(AbstractProcessLauncher.java:196)
        at org.eclipse.tptp.trace.ui.internal.launcher.deleg.application.PIJUnitLauncherDelegate.configureProcess(PIJUnitLauncherDelegate.java:49)
        at org.eclipse.tptp.trace.ui.provisional.launcher.PrimaryLaunchDelegate.run(PrimaryLaunchDelegate.java:252)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:595)
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui 4 4 2007-11-27 11:14:19.565
!MESSAGE 

Do I have to configure it outside of eclipse like the RAC?

> Do I have to configure it outside of eclipse like the RAC?

No, IAC should be configed automatically by itself.
What happens when you open Profiler Dialog, create new "External Java Application" and click "Test Connection" button?

IWAT0284E The agent controller is not available on host localhost.
 Make sure that:
* the agent controller is installed.
* the agent controller is configured to communicate with your machine.
* you have the correct host name and port number for the agent controller.
org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.local.control.AgentControllerUnavailableException

Martin,
Have you installed TPTP runtime via Update Manager?
In this case, some file attrubutes might be not set.

To test IAC please try to reinstall TPTP Runtime manually:
- install Eclipse in new location
- download TPTP Runtime 4.5 and install it manually.

> IWAT0284E The agent controller is not available on host localhost.
>  Make sure that:
> * the agent controller is installed.
> * the agent controller is configured to communicate with your machine.
> * you have the correct host name and port number for the agent controller.
> org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.local.control.AgentControllerUnavailableException
No, I installed the all in one package from the tptp developer download site. The package is from 2007-11-13. This is the same date that the working rac is from.

Martin,
Could you please check IAC's configuration and log files in the folder
%ECLIPSE_HOME%/plugins/org.eclipse.tptp.platform.ac.[YOUR_PLATFORM]_[BUILD_NUMBER]/agent_controller/config?
There are an empty serviceconfig.log and no log files.
